TopicTitle: Sun orbit...(Get the lowest orbit possible)

Articles.Content:
The year is 2150 and NASA has developed a device that takes solar energy and beams the power to Kerbin. The only problem is that you need to get the solar panels as close as possible with out dying...It would be nice if you could land on the sun...but you don't think you can. So attempt to fly up and get as close as you can.

Entries must be in a screen shot and posted down below

lowest orbit wins first place...and gets 10000 points

2nd....5000 points

3rd....2500points

extras:

attempt to land on a single planet before for 100 points...(picture needed)

Move and asteroid into that orbit and keep it there... 500 added(picture needed)

1 kerbal equals 50 points(Picture needed)

using 1 tank of fuel equals 100 points(Picture needed)

RULES:

time limit to 5 minutes

1.NO hacks...except when leaving kerbin's gravity suck as infinite fuel wen leaving kerbin but as soon as you get out of it and into the suns sphere of influence then it is time to start the clock

2.Attempt with no mods...except for a two...posted later

3.must have at least one solar panel attached and some form of communication

4.mods allowing you to beam the energy to kerbin is allowed and encouraged,and a mod to cool the ship when you get close to the sun

5.Have fun...and remember were all counting on you

Here is an idea how to conduct such a mission with no infinite fuel cheat.

1. Go for an Eve intercept where a retrograde slingshot gets you into a Moho intercept. Carefully aero brake to cut speed further but be careful that you don't get captured into an orbit or crash on Eve.

2. Use a Moho retrograde slingshot to further degrade your solar orbit.

3. Use any additional slingshots to get close to the desired parigee.

4. Burn to circularize.

The probe example I used went there directly. With the intercepts, you can save a ton of Delta V in achieving the mission goal without the fuel cheat. A LV-N and Ion engines would be desirable in avoiding having to make a ridiculously huge launcher.

Expect the mission to take several years of Kerbal time to complete.
